benchmark_details.name: CORE (Conversational Robustness Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: CORE is a metric to quantify the effectiveness of language use within multi-agent systems across different game-theoretic interactions, integrating measures of cluster entropy, lexical repetition, and semantic similarity to evaluate dialog quality.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of linguistic diversity and quality in multi-agent conversations driven by game-theoretic incentives.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Limited to dyadic interactions and short-term dialogs, may not capture the full complexity of emergent communication in larger or longer-term agent collectives.

data.source: Simulated dialogs between pairs of LLM agents under competitive, cooperative, and neutral conditions.

methodology.calculation: CORE is calculated based on normalized mode entropy, repetition penalty, and semantic stagnation penalty from dialog data.
methodology.interpretation: Higher CORE values indicate more lexically diverse and high-quality interactions within dialogs.
methodology.validation: Statistical significance testing using Mann-Whitney U tests for comparing interaction modes.
